results.title: Medieval England: the peasants revolt
results.brief_description: The harsh social inequities of the Middle Ages form the background for this film. By focusing on the Peasants’ Revolt of 1381- a determined thrust for freedom by English peasants against the intolerable conditions of the manor - the film examines the grim reality of life in the late Middle Ages. Cast includes Anthony Hopkins, Edward Fox.

results.title: Medieval Dutch sculpture
results.creator_credit: Johan Feltkamp and Piet Van Moock
results.brief_description: A survey of sculpture in the Netherlands during the late Middle Ages. Although much of the sculpture of this period was destroyed in the 16th Century, sufficient remains in museums and private collections to show how the emotional quality of the early Gothic period gradually merged into the more realistic and mannered style of the later period. Statuettes are examined which express in wood and stone a series of emotions: humility, cruelty, love, pathos and humour. Narrator Gordon Jones.

results.title: Medicine in Sport (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ken Ashton, Tom Poole and Annabel Olivier-Wright
results.brief_description: Provides an in-depth look at training routines of top soccer stars. Traces the history of soccer, and also looks at the basic skills every soccer player needs.

results.title: Medical self-help: emergency childbirth
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of Health, Education and Welfare
results.brief_description: Teaches the individual how to take care of his medical and health needs in time of disaster when medical assistance might not be readily available. Presents instructions on emergency childbirth at home. Uses animated drawings.

results.title: Medical Scotland
results.creator_credit: LRC Agnew, AR Productions and Dept of Medical History UCLA
results.brief_description: A history of Scotland’s medical heritage begins with early Gaelic medical manuscripts. Shows the instigation of medical learning at Aberdeen University in 1494; the first medical book written in 1568. Profiles famous medical schools in Glasgow and Edinburgh and their many famous students. Alexander Fleming’s discovery of penicillin, physician writers such as Tobias Smillet, AJ Cronin and David Livingston, famous explorer. Others profiled are Charles Darwin who studied at Edinburgh and Sir Arthur Conan Doyle who was influenced by one of his professors to develop the character of Sherlock Holmes. Also tells stories of ‘body snatching’.

results.title: Media: massaging the mind (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Patrick Corbett, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Hobel-Leiterman Productions
results.brief_description: Analysis (from a 1970’s point of view) of the future directions of American mass media, Industry people argue for specialised anchors, print journalism, vertical programming and electronic imaging - to name but a few - as the direction for the future. However, such directions are not always considered favourable. Also looks at the role of politics, youth and community in media.

results.title: Media school
results.brief_description: A report on a course in communications with a group of 16 year-old boys from Melbourne High School. The media school is residential and the experiences range through music, mass media and personal relationships. An important featujre is the free open approachto life in general. Made as a segment for the ABC’s “This Day Tonight” program.

results.title: Medecin Malgre Lui
results.brief_description:
Argan, a hypochondriac who coughs constantly to impress upon his family and physicians the gravity of his condition. So concerned is Argan for his health that he resolves his daughter must marry a medical student, thereby ensuring he has a doctor near him at all times.

Credits: Director, Francois Gir ; photography, Robert Juillard ; music, Dominique Paladilhe.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Darras, Rosy Varte, Claude Nicot, G. Audoubert, Herve Sand, Dora Doll, Giani Esposito.

results.title: Mechanised batter stabilzation
results.brief_description: When roads, waterways and railways are made through a cutting, erosion occurs on the banks or batters. The subsoil having been largely removed, grass or other plants will not easily grow. Mechanised equipment is now used to stabilise these batters. First the eroded gullies are eliminated, then a mixture of bitumen and straw mulch applied and finally water, seed and fertilizer sprayed on. The bitumen stabilises the soil, the straw mulch protects the seedlings and pasture regeneration is no longer a problem.
